programme.title: Nineteen Nineteen
programme.desc: Two former patients of Sigmund Freud meet again and discuss the psychiatric treatment they underwent 65 years earlier. Period drama, starring Paul Scofield and Maria Schell.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: An American couple on holiday in Morocco witness the killing of a local man they have befriended. Before dying he whispers a secret that has serious political implications - but they are prevented from telling the police when their son is kidnapped by a gang of spies bent on keeping them silent. Alfred Hitchcock's remake of his own 1934 thriller, with James Stewart, Doris Day, Bernard Miles and Daniel Gelin.(n)

programme.title: Oh! What a Lovely War
programme.desc: First World War musical, comprising a series of satirical sketches highlighting the futility of conflict from the perspective of the ordinary soldiers - many from the same family - and covering famous historical moments, including the Christmas truce. Richard Attenborough's directorial debut, starring Ralph Richardson, Laurence Olivier, John Mills and John Gielgud.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: A shy, naive lawyer falls foul of a gunslinger while on his way to the backwoods town of Shinbone. His life is saved by a local woman, and he in turn devotes himself to helping the townsfolk while searching for a way to bring the bandit to justice. However, he finally comes to realise that a more aggressive approach will be needed. John Ford's Western, starring James Stewart, Lee Marvin, John Wayne, Woody Strode and Vera Miles.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: An American couple on holiday in Morocco witness the killing of a local man they have befriended. Before dying he whispers a secret that has serious political implications - but they are prevented from telling the police when their son is kidnapped by a gang of spies bent on keeping them silent. Alfred Hitchcock's remake of his own 1934 thriller, with James Stewart, Doris Day, Bernard Miles and Daniel Gelin.(n)

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.(n)

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder
programme.desc: Four brothers are reunited at their mother's funeral and discover their father was swindled out of his farm and subsequently murdered. However, as they set about avenging his death and reclaiming his land, a crook frames them for killing the sheriff. Western, starring John Wayne, Dean Martin, Earl Holliman, Michael Anderson Jr, James Gregory, George Kennedy and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: Oh! What a Lovely War
programme.desc: First World War musical, comprising a series of satirical sketches highlighting the futility of conflict from the perspective of the ordinary soldiers - many from the same family - and covering famous historical moments, including the Christmas truce. Richard Attenborough's directorial debut, starring Ralph Richardson, Laurence Olivier, John Mills and John Gielgud.(n)

programme.title: Nineteen Nineteen
programme.desc: Two former patients of Sigmund Freud meet again and discuss the psychiatric treatment they underwent 65 years earlier. Period drama, starring Paul Scofield and Maria Schell.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: A shy, naive lawyer falls foul of a gunslinger while on his way to the backwoods town of Shinbone. His life is saved by a local woman, and he in turn devotes himself to helping the townsfolk while searching for a way to bring the bandit to justice. However, he finally comes to realise that a more aggressive approach will be needed. John Ford's Western, starring James Stewart, Lee Marvin, John Wayne, Woody Strode and Vera Miles.(n)

programme.title: The Cinema List: The 90s
programme.desc: Alex Zane and celebrity film fans go back to the 90s to celebrate some of the decade's greatest films, from classic comedies to epic blockbusters.(n)

programme.title: North Hollywood
programme.desc: A youngster must decide between choosing the future his father wants and following his dream of becoming a pro skateboarder. Confronted with the uncertainty of his future - and how it might impact his friends and family - he takes steps to build relationships with professional skaters in an effort to forge his own path. Comedy drama, starring Ryder McLaughlin, Vince Vaughn and Miranda Cosgrove.(n)

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga - Chapter 1
programme.desc: Families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas during the 19th century. Meanwhile, a seasoned cowboy goes on the run with a prostitute and a young lad after killing a fellow gunman. Western, starring Kevin Costner, who also co-wrote and directed, with Sienna Miller and Sam Worthington.(n)

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.(n)

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder
programme.desc: Four brothers are reunited at their mother's funeral and discover their father was swindled out of his farm and subsequently murdered. However, as they set about avenging his death and reclaiming his land, a crook frames them for killing the sheriff. Western, starring John Wayne, Dean Martin, Earl Holliman, Michael Anderson Jr, James Gregory, George Kennedy and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Biopic of hip-hop group NWA, examining their rise to fame in the 1980s. The five members of the group drew inspiration from their anger at the dangerous world they saw around them, producing hard-hitting songs about urban life that redefined a musical genre. Starring O'Shea Jackson Jr, Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell, Neil Brown Jr and Aldis Hodge.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.(n)

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga - Chapter 1
programme.desc: Families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas during the 19th century. Meanwhile, a seasoned cowboy goes on the run with a prostitute and a young lad after killing a fellow gunman. Western, starring Kevin Costner, who also co-wrote and directed, with Sienna Miller and Sam Worthington.(n)

programme.title: The Starling Girl
programme.desc: A young woman struggles with her place within her Christian fundamentalist community, but everything changes when a charismatic pastor returns to her church. Writer/director Laurel Parmet's drama, starring Eliza Scanlen and Lewis Pullman.(n)

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: An American prizefighter retires after killing an opponent in the ring, and returns to his Irish roots in a village in Galway, where he falls for a local woman. Unfortunately, their romance is hampered by a conflict with her brother over a property matter. John Ford's Oscar-winning romantic comedy drama, starring John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Victor McLaglen, Barry Fitzgerald and Ward Bond.(n)

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenager's body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiner's 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry O'Connell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss.(n)

programme.title: The Starling Girl
programme.desc: A young woman struggles with her place within her Christian fundamentalist community, but everything changes when a charismatic pastor returns to her church. Writer/director Laurel Parmet's drama, starring Eliza Scanlen and Lewis Pullman.(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Biopic of hip-hop group NWA, examining their rise to fame in the 1980s. The five members of the group drew inspiration from their anger at the dangerous world they saw around them, producing hard-hitting songs about urban life that redefined a musical genre. Starring O'Shea Jackson Jr, Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell, Neil Brown Jr and Aldis Hodge.(n)

programme.title: Drift
programme.desc: A young woman escapes her war-torn country to a Greek island, growing close with a tour guide as the pair find hope in each other. Director Anthony Chen's drama, starring Cynthia Erivo and Alia Shawkat.(n)

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: An American prizefighter retires after killing an opponent in the ring, and returns to his Irish roots in a village in Galway, where he falls for a local woman. Unfortunately, their romance is hampered by a conflict with her brother over a property matter. John Ford's Oscar-winning romantic comedy drama, starring John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Victor McLaglen, Barry Fitzgerald and Ward Bond.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.(n)

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenager's body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiner's 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry O'Connell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss.(n)

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: An idealistic sports agent produces a mission statement at work promising to treat clients fairly. Unfortunately, it costs him his job. Forced to set up an agency on his own, the only people prepared to stand by him are a lovelorn staff accountant and a footballer. Cameron Crowe's romantic comedy drama, with Tom Cruise, Renee Zellweger, Kelly Preston, Jonathan Lipnicki, and Cuba Gooding Jr, who won an Oscar for his performance.(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.(n)

programme.title: Drift
programme.desc: A young woman escapes her war-torn country to a Greek island, growing close with a tour guide as the pair find hope in each other. Director Anthony Chen's drama, starring Cynthia Erivo and Alia Shawkat.(n)

programme.title: Love Story
programme.desc: Two students at Harvard University fall in love, but their romance is fated to be cut tragically short by the discovery that one of them has a terminal illness. Romantic drama, starring Ali MacGraw, Ryan O'Neal and Ray Milland.(n)

programme.title: Funny Face
programme.desc: A high-flying photographer arranges a photoshoot in a Greenwich bookshop, where his head is turned by one of the employees. He persuades the shy bookworm to model for him in Paris, and romance blossoms between them as he endeavours to transform her into a fashion icon. Musical, starring Fred Astaire, Audrey Hepburn, Kay Thompson, Michel Auclair and Robert Flemyng, with songs by George and Ira Gershwin.(n)

programme.title: Girl You Know It's True
programme.desc: During the 1980s, dancers Rob Pilatus and Fabrice Morvan become pop stars as Milli Vanilli, but unknown to their fans, they are lip-syncing to other artists. Biographical drama, starring Elan Ben Ali, Tijan Njie and Matthias Schweighofer.(n)

programme.title: Love Story
programme.desc: Two students at Harvard University fall in love, but their romance is fated to be cut tragically short by the discovery that one of them has a terminal illness. Romantic drama, starring Ali MacGraw, Ryan O'Neal and Ray Milland.(n)

programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. Starring Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Michael Kitchen, Klaus Maria Brandauer and Leslie Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Cicada
programme.desc: As they continue to recover from separate traumatic events, two young men gradually start to fall for each other. Drama, starring Matthew Fifer and Sheldon D Brown.(n)

Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.(n)

programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. programme.title: Cicada
programme.desc: As they continue to recover from separate traumatic events, two young men gradually start to fall for each other. Drama, starring Matthew Fifer and Sheldon D Brown.(n)

programme.title: Burlesque
programme.desc: A woman goes to work as a cocktail waitress at a burlesque club which is teetering on the brink of closure. The manager gives her the chance to perform and she has soon become the venue's star attraction, drawing the attention of a sleazy developer with plans for the site. Musical drama, starring Cher, Christina Aguilera, Cam Gigandet and Stanley Tucci.(n)

programme.title: What If
programme.desc: Wallace is a medical school drop-out who has given up on love after a series of bad break-ups, while Chantry is an animator who lives with her boyfriend. The two become friends since neither is interested in a relationship with the other - but as they grow closer, they begin to wonder if they belong together. Romantic drama, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Zoe Kazan.(n)

programme.title: The Cinema List: Black British Actors
programme.desc: A look at the work of some exceptionally talented Black British actors, from Naomie Harris to Idris Elba and beyond.(n)

programme.title: The Damned United
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling Brian Clough's ill-fated 44-day tenure as boss of Leeds United in 1974, after Don Revie's departure for the job of England's manager. Following his acrimonious split from Derby County and a brief spell at Brighton \u0026 Hove Albion, Clough arrived at Elland Road on a wave of controversy, after previously being an outspoken critic of the club, and struggled to find allies among the playing staff. With Michael Sheen, Timothy Spall, Jim Broadbent and Colm Meaney.(n)

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: An Army officer is accused of murdering a bartender, whom he claims he killed because the man raped his wife. He turns to a tenacious lawyer to get him off the hook, but the attorney faces a challenge because the prosecution alleges the defendant killed the barman because he was having an affair with his wife. Otto Preminger's courtroom drama, starring James Stewart, Ben Gazzara, Lee Remick and Eve Arden.(n)

programme.title: What If

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.(n)

programme.title: Through a Glass Darkly
programme.desc: A former mental institution inmate returns to her family, but faces an uphill struggle to readjust to life in the outside world. Ingmar Bergman's drama, starring Harriet Andersson and Max von Sydow. In Swedish.(n)

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: In 1976, Jamaica is dangerously divided across political lines and musician Bob Marley vows to quell the violence by performing at the Smile Jamaica Concert. Two days before the high-profile gig, gunmen break into the singer's home, shooting Bob, his wife Rita and manager Don Taylor. Everyone survives and Marley moves to London with his entourage to begin work on the LP Exodus under Island Records supremo Chris Blackwell. Biographical drama, starring Kingsley Ben-Adir, Lashana Lynch and James Norton.(n)

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: An Army officer is accused of murdering a bartender, whom he claims he killed because the man raped his wife. He turns to a tenacious lawyer to get him off the hook, but the attorney faces a challenge because the prosecution alleges the defendant killed the barman because he was having an affair with his wife. Otto Preminger's courtroom drama, starring James Stewart, Ben Gazzara, Lee Remick and Eve Arden.(n)

programme.title: L'immensità
programme.desc: In 1970s Rome, a mother contends with her loveless and abusive marriage while caring for her children, one of who is experiencing gender dysphoria and wishes to identify as a boy. Family drama, starring Penélope Cruz, Vincenzo Amato and Luana Giuliani. In Italian.(n)

programme.title: Bookworm
programme.desc: Mildred, an 11-year-old girl, finds her world turned upside down when her estranged father, a washed-up magician, takes her on a wild adventure. Family comedy, starring Elijah Wood and Nell Fisher.(n)

programme.title: The Cinema List: Family Favourites
programme.desc: Discover some of the very best Sky Originals to watch with the whole family, from Monster Family to The Amazing Maurice.(n)

programme.title: Rebellious
programme.desc: A princess is kidnapped by an evil sorcerer and her scholarly fiance must use his wits in an epic quest to find her, while she boldly challenges her captors and plots a daring escape. Animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Vanessa Johansson and Marc Thompson.(n)

programme.title: The Wild Robot
programme.desc: Following a shipwreck, a robot called Roz survives on an uninhabited island with the help of wild animals. Family animation, with the voices of Lupita Nyong'o, Pedro Pascal, Kit Connor and Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Old Guy
programme.desc: An ageing hitman must train a young prodigy when his employer moves to replace the old guard. Director Simon West's comedy, starring Christoph Waltz, Lucy Liu and Cooper Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: A Nice Indian Boy
programme.desc: Naveen brings his fiancé Jay home to meet his traditional Indian family, and they come to terms with his white-orphan-artist boyfriend while planning the wedding of their dreams. Romantic comedy, starring Karan Soni and Jonathan Groff.(n)

programme.title: The Front Room
programme.desc: A newly pregnant couple take in their estranged mother-in-law, who has dangerous and controlling parenting methods. Thriller, starring Brandy Norwood, Andrew Burnap, Kathryn Hunter and Neal Huff.(n)

programme.title: Speak No Evil
programme.desc: On holiday in Europe, American couple Ben and Louise Dalton and their anxiety-crippled daughter Agnes meet English doctor Patrick Feld, his wife Ciara and their young son Ant, who was born without a tongue. The Daltons' vacation soon turns into a nightmare when they are invited to stay on the Felds' country estate. Horror, starring James McAvoy, Mackenzie Davis, Scoot McNairy and Aisling Franciosi.(n)

programme.title: Venom: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Journalist Eddie Brock and symbiote partner-in-crime Venom are lying low in Mexico City, on the run for the apparent murder of detective Patrick Mulligan. The cop and his bonded entity, Toxin, are actually alive at the Imperium symbiote containment programme, beneath the Area 51 US Air Force facility in the Nevada desert. Knull, the symbiotes' immortal creator, dispatches hunters to locate Venom's hidden power source, the Codex, which can set Knull free to terrorise the multiverse. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Hardy, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Stephen Graham and Juno Temple.(n)

Knull, the symbiotes' immortal creator, dispatches hunters to locate Venom's hidden power source, the Codex, which can set Knull free to terrorise the multiverse. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Hardy, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Stephen Graham and Juno Temple.(n)

programme.title: Old Guy
programme.desc: An ageing hitman must train a young prodigy when his employer moves to replace the old guard. Director Simon West's comedy, starring Christoph Waltz, Lucy Liu and Cooper Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: A Nice Indian Boy
programme.desc: Naveen brings his fiancé Jay home to meet his traditional Indian family, and they come to terms with his white-orphan-artist boyfriend while planning the wedding of their dreams. Romantic comedy, starring Karan Soni and Jonathan Groff.(n)

programme.title: The Front Room
programme.desc: A newly pregnant couple take in their estranged mother-in-law, who has dangerous and controlling parenting methods. Thriller, starring Brandy Norwood, Andrew Burnap, Kathryn Hunter and Neal Huff.(n)

programme.title: Escape from the 21st Century
programme.desc: In 1999, after discovering they have the power to travel in time with every sneeze, three friends embark on an adventure to save the world. Fantasy adventure, starring Ruoyun Zhang and Elane Zhong. In Chinese and Mandarin, with English subtitles.(n)

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: After a young mom is found dead on the side of a country road, 40 miles from her Knoxville home, investigators scramble to figure out how she ended up there.(n)

programme.title: Far And Away
programme.desc: Sweeping drama starring Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman as Irish immigrants farming and fighting to survive in the American new world.

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Musical romantic drama starring Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper. Rock star Jackson Maine meets aspiring songwriter Ally, a waitress who moonlights as a bar singer. Mesmerised by Ally's talent, Jackson invites her to perform with him and she becomes a sensation. The two begin a romantic relationship, but their happiness is threatened as an increasingly washed-up Jackson grapples with substance abuse i

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: Futuristic action adventure starring Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron. In a world where water is precious and humanity faces extinction, a one-armed woman takes off across the desert with a lorry-load of females who've been imprisoned to bear children. Riding shotgun is Max, the infamous "Road Warrior".

programme.title: Ready Player One
programme.desc: Sci-fi action thriller starring Tye Sheridan, Olivia Cooke and Mark Rylance. In 2045, society's main entertainment is an ultra-immersive virtual reality simulation called the "OASIS". Its late creator, James Halliday, has hidden an Easter egg within the game that, if unlocked, will grant ownership to the finder. Teen gamer Wade Watts is determined to win the prize, but he has lethal competition in

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Musical comedy starring Jack Black as Dewey Finn, an out-of-work heavy metal guitarist who cons his way into a job teaching at an expensive private school. Introducing the uptight students to the joys of rock music, Finn sets about grooming them for a battle-of-the-bands contest.

programme.title: Passengers
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring Chris Pratt and Jennifer Lawrence. Passengers aboard a corporate spaceship have been put into hibernation for the journey to a colony, but a mechanical engineer accidentally wakes up 90 years ahead of schedule. The journalist he awakens to keep him company is far from impressed as their chances of living long enough to make it to their destination are slim.

programme.title: The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part
programme.desc: Five years after events of the first film, teenager Finn has rebuilt Bricksburg into a post-apocalyptic wasteland. When Emmet is plagued by a vision of an impending cataclysm, he and Lucy fight to protect their beloved city from invaders. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Chris Pratt, Elizabeth Banks and Will Arnett.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Westerns
programme.desc: Saddle up, Cowboy, for a gunslinging edition of the Cinema List. Explore a fistful of modern and classic Western movies to enjoy, from Django Unchained to The Good, The Bad and The Ugly.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Biographical music drama starring Kingsley Ben-Adir. In the late 1970s, after being shot and badly wounded on stage in Jamaica, reggae star Bob Marley decamps to the UK, where he and his band work on the album that will make him a global icon.

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Cillian Murphy and Emily Blunt. During the Second World War, American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer and fellow scientists race against time to develop an atomic bomb before the Nazis. But, during the 1950s Red Scare, his name is dragged through the mud by US officials.

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Musical romantic drama starring Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper. Rock star Jackson Maine meets aspiring songwriter Ally, a waitress who moonlights as a bar singer. programme.title: A Quiet Place: Day One
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror prequel starring Lupita Nyong'o and Joseph Quinn. New York City is suddenly attacked by terrifying alien creatures with super-sensitive hearing. Sam, a terminally ill cancer patient, and law student Eric are among those who have survived the initial assault - but how long can they remain alive when the faintest noise can be deadly?

programme.title: Dune: Part Two
programme.desc: Epic sci-fi drama starring TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Zendaya. With the evil Harkonnen family back in charge of Arrakis, deposed heir Paul Atreides and his mother have taken refuge with the native Fremen in the planet's perilous desert wasteland. Paul becomes close with Fremen warrior Chani and begins to demonstrate powers that persuade her people to aid in the young man's plan to avenge his father and

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
programme.desc: Supernatural adventure starring Paul Rudd, featuring Bill Murray and Dan Aykroyd. The spook-hunting Spengler family joins forces with the original Ghostbusters, whose work is continuing via a secret research lab. When an ancient artefact is discovered and releases an evil force, the team must work together to prevent the dawning of a new Ice Age.

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Tom Cruise, Cuba Gooding Jr and Renee Zellweger. As a top agent at Sports Management International, Jerry Maguire knows his way around and is his own man... until one day he gets an attack of decency and finds himself out of a job. Now he must start from scratch. His only allies are a single mother, her cheeky young son and a second-rate player for the Arizona Cardinals.

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: British crime thriller starring Daniel Craig. A rising young drug dealer wants to make quick money and then retire early to enjoy the benefits. But his plans are thwarted when he is asked by a local crime boss to find the missing daughter of a powerful friend.

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Tom Cruise, Cuba Gooding Jr and Renee Zellweger. As a top agent at Sports Management International, Jerry Maguire knows his way around and is his own man... until one day he gets an attack of decency and finds himself out of a job. Now he must start from scratch. His only allies are a single mother, her cheeky young son and a second-rate player for the Arizona Cardinals.

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: British crime thriller starring Daniel Craig. A rising young drug dealer wants to make quick money and then retire early to enjoy the benefits. But his plans are thwarted when he is asked by a local crime boss to find the missing daughter of a powerful friend.

programme.title: Oppenheimer

programme.title: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
programme.desc: After their unprecedented victory in the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark embark on a Victors Tour. Katniss senses rebellion is stirring, but a cruel change in the upcoming 75th Hunger Games may change Panem forever.

programme.title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 1
programme.desc: After shattering the games forever, Katniss (Jennifer Lawrence) finds herself in District 13, fighting to save Peeta (Josh Hutcherson) and a nation moved by her courage.

programme.title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 2
programme.desc: Katniss faces mortal traps, deadly enemies and moral choices when she and her closest friends leave District 13 to assassinate President Snow and liberate the citizens of war-torn Panem.

programme.title: Gone With the Wind
programme.desc: Presented as originally released in 1939. Includes themes and character depictions which may be offensive and problematic to contemporary audiences. A Southern belle struggles to return her family's estate to its original glory after the Civil War.

programme.title: Green Lantern
programme.desc: The Green Lanterns have little regard for humans, who have been unable to harness the powers of the ring each member wears. But Jordan, a test pilot, may be the corps' only hope when an enemy called Parallax threatens the universal balance of power.

programme.title: An American Bombing: The Road to April 19th
programme.desc: Explores the dangers of escalating homegrown violence in the United States by taking a look at the Oklahoma City bombing in 1995, the deadliest act of domestic terrorism in the country.

programme.title: Stopping The Steal
programme.desc: An inside account of President Trump's challenge to the results of the 2020 presidential election as told by former White House staff and appointees.

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: Conflicting evidence leads a federal agent (Guy Pearce) to question the motives behind a former Special Ops soldier's (Don Cheadle) apparent ties to terrorist groups.

programme.title: Adult Best Friends
programme.desc: Katie takes her best friend on a nostalgic trip to their hometown to tell her she's getting married. Their journey soon takes some unexpected turns courtesy of a bizarre rental homeowner, a bachelor party, and a few potential love interests.

programme.title: Lost River
programme.desc: A single mother is swept into a dark underworld while her son discovers an underwater town.

programme.title: Mickey 17
programme.desc: A disposable employee is sent on a human expedition to colonize the ice world Niflheim. After one iteration dies, a new body is regenerated with most of his memories intact.

programme.title: Mountainhead
programme.desc: Four friends reunite during worldwide economic turmoil.

programme.title: It
programme.desc: Seven young outcasts are about to face their worst nightmare -- an ancient, shape-shifting evil that emerges every 27 years to prey on children. Banding together, the friends must overcome their personal fears to battle the murderous clown Pennywise.

programme.title: It: Chapter Two
programme.desc: Defeated by members of the Losers' Club, the evil clown Pennywise returns 27 years later to terrorize the town of Derry, Maine. Now adults, the united Losers must conquer their deepest fears to destroy the shape-shifting Pennywise once and for all.

programme.title: The Nun II
programme.desc: An evil spreads in 1956 France as a priest is murdered and Sister Irene once again comes face-to-face with the demonic nun Valak.

programme.title: The Wave
programme.desc: When a professor decides to let his students construct their own autocracy, they start forming a nation state eerily similar to Nazi Germany. The professor, along with the other teachers, becomes unnerved and uncertain what to do.

programme.title: Waitress: The Musical
programme.desc: Jenna Hunterson is a waitress and expert pie maker stuck in a small town and a loveless marriage. When a baking contest offers her a chance at escape, Jenna fights to reclaim part of herself.

programme.title: Brandy Hellville & the Cult of Fast Fashion
programme.desc: The Instagram-perfect image of Brandy Melville hides a toxic work culture endemic to fast fashion, with discrimination against race, sex and body size.
